results.prompt: Create a Blueprint that prints 'Hello World' when the game starts.
results.output:
## DSL FORMAT RULES

Your output MUST follow this exact format:

```
BLUEPRINT: HelloWorld
PARENT: Actor

VAR Text:String = "Hello World"

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE 0: Event — Executes:exec
EXEC 0 -> Then:exec

NODE 1: Sequence — Then_0:exec, Then_1:exec
EXEC 0 -> Then_0
EXEC 0 -> Then_1

NODE 2: FlipFlop — A:exec, B:exec, IsA:Bool
EXEC 0 -> A
EXEC 1 -> B
EXEC 0 -> IsA

NODE 3: DoOnce — Execute:exec, Reset:exec
EXEC 0 -> Completed:exec
EXEC 1 -> Reset

NODE 4: Delay — Execute:exec, Duration:Float
EXEC 0 -> Completed:exec
EXEC 1 -> Duration

NODE 5: ForEachLoop — Execute:exec, Array:Array
LOOP Body:exec, ArrayElement:Object, ArrayIndex:Int, Completed:exec
EXEC 0 -> LoopBody
EXEC 1 -> ArrayElement
EXEC 2 -> ArrayIndex
EXEC 3 -> Completed

NODE 6: Gate — Enter:exec, Open:exec, Close:exec, Toggle:exec
EXIT Exit:exec
EXEC 0 -> Enter
EXEC 1 -> Open
EXEC 2 -> Close
EXEC 3 -> Toggle
EXEC 4 -> Exit

NODE 7: AddFloat — A:exec, B:exec
RETURN Value:exec
EXEC 0 -> A
EXEC 1 -> B
EXEC 2 -> Return

NODE 8: SubtractFloat — A:exec, B:exec
RETURN Value:exec
EXEC 0 -> A
EXEC 1 -> B
EXEC 2 -> Return

NODE 9: MultiplyFloat — A:exec, B:exec
RETURN Value:exec
EXEC 0 -> A
EXEC 1 -> B
EXEC 2 -> Return

NODE 10: GetGreaterThan — A:exec, B:exec
RETURN Value:exec
EXEC 0 -> A
EXEC 1 -> B
EXEC 2 -> Return

NODE 11: LessThan — A:exec, B:exec
RETURN Value:exec
EXEC 0 -> A
EXEC 1 -> B
EXEC 2 -> Return

NODE 12: ClampFloat — Value:exec, Min:exec, Max:exec
RETURN Value:exec
EXEC 0 -> Value
EXEC 1 -> Min
EXEC 2 -> Max
EXEC 3 -> Return

NODE 13: MakeRotator — Roll:exec, Pitch:exec, Yaw:exec
RETURN Value:exec
EXEC 0 -> Roll
EXEC 1 -> Pitch
EXEC 2 -> Yaw
EXEC 3 -> Return

NODE 14: MakeVector — X:exec, Y:exec, Z:exec
RETURN Value:exec
EXEC 0 -> X
EXEC 1 -> Y
EXEC 2 -> Z
EXEC 3 -> Return

NODE 15: PrintString — Execute:exec, InString:String
THEN Then:exec
EXEC 0 -> Execute
EXEC 1 -> InString
EXEC 2 -> Then

NODE 16: SetTimerByFunctionName — Execute:exec, FunctionName:String, Time:exec, bLooping:exec
THEN Then:exec
EXEC 0 -> Execute
EXEC 1 -> FunctionName
EXEC 2 -> Time
EXEC 3 -> bLooping
EXEC 4 -> Then

NODE 17: GetWorldDeltaSeconds — THEN ReturnValue:exec
EXEC 0 -> Then

NODE

results.output:
## DSL FORMAT RULES

Your output MUST follow this exact format:

```
BLUEPRINT: Actor
PARENT: Actor

VAR Health: Int = 100
VAR CurrentScene: Scene = Scene:exec

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE Execute: Event
EXEC Then:exec

NODE SetActorHiddenInGame: Custom
EXEC Execute:exec, bNewHidden:Bool
OUT Then:exec

NODE AddActorLocalRotation: Custom
EXEC Execute:exec, DeltaRotation:Rotator
OUT Then:exec

NODE GetDistanceTo: Custom
EXEC Execute:exec, OtherActor:Actor
OUT Then:exec, ReturnValue:Float

NODE PlaySound: Audio
EXEC Execute:exec, Sound:Object
OUT Then:exec

NODE CastToCharacter: Casting
EXEC Execute:exec, Object:Object
OUT CastSucceeded:exec, CastFailed:exec, AsCharacter:Object

NODE SetVisibility: Component
EXEC Execute:exec, Target:Object, NewVisibility:Bool
OUT Then:exec

NODE SetRelativeRotation: Component
EXEC Execute:exec, Target:Object, NewRotation:Rotator
OUT Then:exec

NODE Event_BeginPlay: Events
OUT Then:exec

NODE Event_Tick: Events
EXEC Then:exec, DeltaSeconds:Float
OUT Then:exec

NODE Event_ActorBeginOverlap: Events
EXEC Then:exec, OtherActor:Actor
OUT Then:exec

NODE Event_ActorEndOverlap: Events
EXEC Then:exec, OtherActor:Actor
OUT Then:exec

NODE Event_InputAction: Events
EXEC Pressed:exec, Released:exec
OUT Then:exec

NODE Event_CustomEvent: Events
EXEC Then:exec
OUT Then:exec

NODE Branch: FlowControl
EXEC Execute:exec, Condition:Bool
OUT True:exec, False:exec

NODE Sequence: FlowControl
EXEC Then_0:exec, Then_1:exec, Then_2:exec
OUT Then_0:exec, Then_1:exec, Then_2:exec

NODE FlipFlop: FlowControl
EXEC A:exec, B:exec, IsA:Bool
OUT A:exec, B:exec, IsA:exec

NODE DoOnce: FlowControl
EXEC Execute:exec, Reset:exec
OUT Completed:exec

NODE Delay: FlowControl
EXEC Execute:exec, Duration:Float
OUT Completed:exec

NODE ForEachLoop: FlowControl
EXEC Execute:exec, Array:Array
OUT LoopBody:exec, ArrayElement:Object, ArrayIndex:Int, Completed:exec

NODE Gate: FlowControl
EXEC Enter:exec, Open:exec, Close:exec, Toggle:exec
OUT Exit:exec

NODE AddFloat: Math
EXEC A:exec, B:exec
OUT ReturnValue:exec

NODE SubtractFloat: Math
EXEC A:exec, B:exec
OUT ReturnValue:exec

NODE MultiplyFloat: Math
EXEC A:exec, B:exec
OUT ReturnValue:exec

NODE GreaterThan: Math
EXEC A:exec, B:exec
OUT ReturnValue:exec

NODE LessThan: Math
EXEC A:exec, B:exec
OUT ReturnValue:exec

NODE ClampFloat: Math
EXEC Value:exec, Min:exec, Max:exec
OUT ReturnValue:exec

NODE MakeRotator: Math
EXEC Roll:exec, Pitch:exec, Yaw:exec
OUT ReturnValue:exec

NODE MakeVector: Math
EXEC X:exec, Y:exec, Z:exec
OUT ReturnValue:exec

NODE PrintString: Utility
EXEC Execute:exec, InString:exec
OUT Then:exec

NODE SetTimerByFunctionName: Utility
EXEC Execute:

results.prompt: Create a Blueprint that toggles a light on and off when the player presses E.
results.output:
BLUEPRINT: PlayerBlueprint
PARENT: Actor

VAR Camera:Object = Camera
VAR Sound:Object = SoundEffect
VAR IsPlaying:Bool = False

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE Enter:exec -> Then:exec
NODE Press:exec -> Then:exec, SetIsPlaying:exec
NODE Release:exec -> Then:exec, ClearIsPlaying:exec
NODE Update:exec -> Then:exec, SetCamera:Object, SetRelativeRotation:Object
NODE Audio:exec -> Then:exec, Play:Object
NODE Exit:exec -> Then:exec

EXEC Enter -> Then
EXEC Press -> SetIsPlaying, EXEC Release -> ClearIsPlaying, EXEC Update -> SetCamera, EXEC Audio -> Play
DATA Enter -> Then [exec] -> Exit [exec] [Bool]
DATA Press -> Then [exec] -> Exit [exec] [Bool], DATA Release -> Then [exec] -> Exit [exec] [Bool], DATA Update -> Then [exec] -> Exit [exec] [Transform]
DATA Audio -> Then [exec] -> Exit [exec] [Object]

## DSL FORMAT RULES

Your output MUST follow this exact format:

```
BLUEPRINT: <Name>
PARENT: <ParentClass>

VAR <Name>: <Type> = <DefaultValue>

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE <id>: <NodeType> [Property=Value]

EXEC <from_id>.<pin> -> <to_id>.<pin>
DATA <from_id>.<pin> -> <to_id>.<pin> [<DataType>]
```

Rules:
- Node IDs use n1, n2, n3... numbering
- EXEC lines = white execution wires
- DATA lines = colored data wires, always include [Type]
- Every exec chain must start from an Event node
- Only use node types and pin names from the reference below

## NODE REFERENCE

Valid node types with their pins. Use ONLY these exact names.

### Actor

**SetActorHiddenInGame** — Shows or hides the actor in game
  IN: Execute:exec, bNewHidden:Bool
  OUT: Then:exec

**AddActorLocalRotation** — Adds rotation to the actor in local space
  IN: Execute:exec, DeltaRotation:Rotator
  OUT: Then:exec

**GetDistanceTo** — Gets the distance between this actor and another
  IN: Execute:exec, OtherActor:Actor
  OUT: Then:exec, ReturnValue:Float

### Audio

**PlaySound** — Plays a sound effect
  IN: Execute:exec, Sound:Object
  OUT: Then:exec

### Casting

**CastToCharacter** — Attempts to cast an object to the Character class
  IN: Execute:exec, Object:Object
  OUT: CastSucceeded:exec, CastFailed:exec, AsCharacter:Object

### Components

**SetVisibility** — Sets visibility of a component
  IN: Execute:exec, Target:Object, NewVisibility:Bool
  OUT: Then:exec

**SetRelativeRotation** — Sets the relative rotation of a component
  IN: Execute:exec, Target:Object, NewRotation:Rotator
  OUT: Then:exec

### Events

**Event_BeginPlay** — Fires once when the game starts or the actor is spawned
  OUT: Then:exec

**Event_Tick** — Fires every frame
  OUT: Then:exec, DeltaSeconds:Float

**Event_ActorBeginOverlap** — Fires when another actor overlaps this actor
  OUT: Then:exec, OtherActor:Actor

**Event_ActorEndOverlap** — Fires when an overlapping actor stops overlapping
  OUT: Then:exec, OtherActor:Actor

**Event_InputAction** —
